DescriptionOfHolding.description: A brief description of the data held by this provider Note: This field allows lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax. Line breaks within the text are preserved.

Organizations.description: The data provider, or organization, or institution responsible for all data and metadata submitted to the CMR .

Administrators.description: A list of users EDL users to be in the administrator group for this provider

items.$comment: The pattern is based on the rules found at https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/users/new

ContactPersons.description: This is the contact persons of the downloadable tool or web user interface.

ContactGroups.description: Group(s) to contact at an organization to get information about the web user interface or downloadable tool, including how the group may be contacted.

MetadataSpecification.description: Requires the client, or user, to add in schema information into every tool record. It includes the schema's name, version, and URL location. The information is controlled through enumerations at the end of this schema.

OrganizationType.description: Describes the organization or group that will be responsible for ingesting and maintaining metadata records and their permissions in the CMR. The information includes details such as its name, who to contact, etc.

Roles.description: Describes the functions that the organization performs.

ShortName.description: This is the minimalistic name of the organization.

LongName.description: This is the full name of the organization

URLValue.description: The web site location where more information about the organization can be found.

Roles.description: Describes the functions of the group or sub organization that they perform.

ContactInformation.description: Describes how and when to contact the group or organization.

GroupName.description: This is the contact group name.

Roles.description: Describes a specific persons function in the organization.

ContactInformation.description: Describes how and when to contact the person.

ContactInformationType.description: Defines the data structure for the organization, person, or group contact details.

HoursOfService.description: Time period when the contact answers questions or provides services.

ContactInstruction.description: Supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the responsible party.

ContactMechanisms.description: Provides a list of ways the responsible party can be contacted.

ContactMechanismType.description: Method for contacting the organization. A contact can be available via phone, email, Facebook, Twitter, Slack, etc.

Type.description: This is the method type for contacting the responsible party - phone, email, Facebook, Twitter, Slack, etc.

Value.description: This is the contact phone number, email address, Facebook address, or Twitter handle associated with the contact method.

ProviderOrganizationShortNameType.description: The unique name of the service organization.

ProviderOrganizationRoleEnum.description: Defines the possible values of service provider functions.

LongNameType.description: The expanded or full name related to the short name.

ContactRoleEnum.description: Defines the possible values of a service provider function.

ContactMechanismTypeEnum.description: Defines the possible ways that the organization can be contacted.

AddressType.description: This entity contains the physical address details for the contact.

StreetAddresses.description: An address line for the street address, used for mailing or physical addresses of organizations or individuals who serve as contacts for the service.

City.description: The city portion of the physical address.

StateProvince.description: The state or province portion of the physical address.

Country.description: The country of the physical address.

PostalCode.description: The zip or other postal code portion of the physical address.

MetadataSpecificationType.description: This object requires any metadata record that is validated by this schema to provide information about the schema.

URL.description: This element represents the URL where the schema lives. The schema can be downloaded.

Name.description: This element represents the name of the schema.

Version.description: This element represents the version of the schema.
